isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SYSTEM DESCRIPTION - LIFT AXLE - STATIC LOADED RADIUS

svcproc.title: LIFT AXLE - STATIC LOADED RADIUS
svcproc.para: The Static Loaded Radius (SLR) of the tires mounted on a load axle is one of the factors used to establish the ride height of the lift axle ( FIGURE 4). A correct installation requires that the installed suspension ride height be within a specific range when the vehicle is in its loaded condition. To insure correct axle operation, the SLR of any tire/wheel combination mounted on the axle should be the same as the SLR value used during installation of the axle assembly.
